page.title: 07The Parish Church.
page.content: Blakesley Church is largely a 13C building, much restored in Victorian times when the present chancel was built. Having such a building to look after involves the congregation in great expense and we are currently facing a restoration programme costing some 20,000 pounds which becomes more reasonable if a 40% grant is allocated by English Heritage. The Eucharist is our Sun. service with a congregation of about 30. The vicar also ministers to Adstone a small village 3 miles away. He is involved with Blakesley School and serves as a School Governor, currently acting as vice-chairman. The children come to church for a service on Ascension Day and at Harvest.The most popular service is the Crib Blessing and telling of Christmas Story on Christmas Eve. Whole families come then. Midnight Mass follows later.
